gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਦੂਤੀ ੲਿਤ ਦ੍ਰੁਗਾ ਬੁਲਾੲੀ ॥ ਕਾਨ ਲਾਗ ਨੀਕੇ ਸਮੁਝਾੲੀ ॥
transliteration: Siv Dootoo It Drougad Bulaaoo|| Kaan Laag Nooke Samujhaaoo||
translation: On this side, Durga after reflecting, called a female messenger of Shiva and making her conscious gave this message in her ear:

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਕੋ ਭੇਜ ਦੀਜੀਅੈ ਤਹਾਂ ॥ ਦੈਤ ਰਾਜ ੲਿਸਥਿਤ ਹੈ ਜਹਾਂ ॥੩੯॥੧੯੫॥
transliteration: Siv Ko Bhej Doojooat Tahaan|| Dait Raaj Isthit Hai Jahaan||39||195||
translation: “Send Lord Shiva to the place, where the demon-king is standing.”39.195.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਦੂਤੀ ਜਬ ੲਿਮ ਸੁਨ ਪਾਵਾ ॥ ਸਿਵਹਿ ਦੂਤ ਕਰਿ ੳੁਤੈ ਪਠਾਵਾ ॥
transliteration: Siv Dootoo Jab Im Soun Paavaa|| Sivah(i) Doot Kar(i) Outai Pathaavaa||
translation: When the female messenger of Shiva heard this, she sent Shiva as a messenger of Shiva

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਦੂਤੀ ਤਾ ਤੇ ਭਯੋ ਨਾਮਾ ॥ ਜਾਨਤ ਸਕਲ ਪੁਰਖ ਅਰੁ ਬਾਮਾ ॥੪੦॥੧੯੬॥
transliteration: Siv Dootoo Taa Te Bhayo Naamaa|| Jaanat Sakal Purakh Ar(u) Baamaa||40||196||
translation: Since that day, the name of Durga became" shiv- Duti" ( the messenger of shiva ), all men and women know this.40.196.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਕਹੀ ਦੈਤ ਰਾਜ ਸੁਨਿ ਬਾਤਾ ॥ ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਕਹਿਓ ਤੁਮਹੁ ਜਗਮਾਤਾ ॥
transliteration: Siv Kahoo Dait Raaj Soun(i) Baataa|| Ih Bidh(i) Kahio Toum-hu Jagmaataa||
translation: Shiva said to the demon-king, “Listen to my words, the mother of she universe hath said this;

gurmukhi: ਦੇਵਨ ਕੌ ਦੈ ਕੈ ਠਕੁਰਾੲੀ ॥ ਕੈਂ ਮਾਂਡਹੁ ਹਮ ਸੰਗ ਲਰਾੲੀ ॥੪੧॥੧੯੭॥
transliteration: Devan Kau Dai Kai Thakuraaoo|| Kain Maandauh Ham San Laraaoo||41||197||
translation: “That either you return the kingdom to gods or wage the war with me.”41.197.

gurmukhi: ਦੈਤ ਰਾਜ ੲਿਹ ਬਾਤ ਨ ਮਾਨੀ ॥ ਅਾਪ ਚਲੇ ਜੂਝਨ ਅਭਿਮਾਨੀ ॥
transliteration: Dait Raaj Eh Baat Na Maanoo|| Aap Chale Joojhan Abimaanoo||
translation: The demon-king Sumbh did not accept this proposal and in his pride, marched forward for war.

gurmukhi: ਗਰਜਤ ਕਾਲਿ ਕਾਲ ਜਯੋਂ ਜਹਾਂ ॥ ਪ੍ਰਾਪਤਿ ਭਯੋ ਅਸੁਰਪਤਿ ਤਹਾਂ ॥੪੨॥੧੯੮॥
transliteration: Gadjat Kaaloo Kaal Jyon Jahaan|| Praapat(i) Bhayo Asurpat(i) Tahaan||42||198||
translation: The place where Kali, like death, was thundering, that demon-king reached there.42.198.

gurmukhi: ਚਮਕੀ ਤਹਾਂ ਅਸਿਨ ਕੀ ਧਾਰਾ ॥ ਨਾਚੇ ਭੂਤ ਪ੍ਰੇਤ ਬੈਤਾਰਾ ॥
transliteration: Chamkoo Tahaan Asin Koo Dhaaraa|| Naache Bhoot Prêt Baitaaraa||
translation: There the edges of sword glistened and the ghosts, goblins and evil spirits began to dance.

gurmukhi: ਫਰਕੇ ਅੰਧ ਕਬੰਧ ਅਚੇਤਾ ॥ ਭਿਭਰੇ ਭੲੀ ਰਵ ਭੀਮ ਅਨੇਕਾ ॥੪੩॥੧੯੯॥
transliteration: Pharke Andh Kabandh Achaataa|| Bhibbre Bhaoo Rav Bhoom Anekaa||43||199||
translation: There the blind headless trunks came into motion senselessly. There many Bhairavas and Bhimas began to roam.43.199.

gurmukhi: ਤੁਰਹੀ ਢੋਲ ਨਗਾਰੇ ਬਾਜੇ ॥ ਭਾਂਤ ਭਾਂਤ ਜੋਧਾ ਰਣ ਗਾਜੇ ॥
transliteration: Tur-hoo Dhol Nagdare Baaje|| Bhaant Bhaant Jodhaa Ran Gadje||
translation: The clarionets, drums and trumpets sounded any many types.

gurmukhi: ਢਡਿ ਡਫ ਡਮਰੁ ਡੁਗਡੁਗੀ ਘਨੀ ॥ ਨਾੲਿ ਨਫੀਰੀ ਜਾਤ ਨ ਗਨੀ ॥੪੪॥੨੦੦॥
transliteration: Dhad(i) Daph Damar(u) Dougdudoo Ghanoo|| Naae Naphooroo Jaat Na Gadoo||44||200||
translation: The tambourines, tabors etc., were played loudly and the musical instruments like Shahnai etc., were being played in such numbers that they cannot be counted.44.200.
The horses are neighing and the trumpets are resounding.
